results.title: Hoffnung's birds bees and storks
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
A cautionary tale told by a father to his teenage son. He is revealing with great embarrassment to himself, the facts of life. However it seems the father is without knowledge himself, and at the end has managed to say very little. Based on the cartoon drawings of Gerard Hoffnung. Narrated by Peter Sellars with animation by Tony Guy.

results.title: The Hoffnung music academy
results.creator_credit: John Halas, British Broadcasting Corporation and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
When the music professor rings his bell for his pupils, we take a trip round his Academy to see the various departments in action, including the piano deparment, folk music, military department and church music. Animated film based on the cartoon drawings of Gerard Hoffnung.

results.title: The Hoffnung maestro
results.creator_credit: Harold Whitaker, John Halas, BBC Enterprises and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Hoffnung”.
As the maestro conducts, a series of characters and situations express the varying moods of the music. Based on the drawings by Gerard Hoffnung. Credits include: storyboard and design by Tom Bailey; sound by Jack King; animation by Harold Whitaker and music by Francis Chagrin.

results.title: David and Betsey Trotwood (from David Copoperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Shows the change in Betsy Trotwood’s feelings toward David Copperfield, from her outrage at the time of his birth to her protectiveness of David against the unpleasant Murdstones some years later, in spite of her dislike of donkeys and small boys.

results.title: Mr Pickwick's dilemma from 'Pickwick Papers'
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis, Dickension Society, London and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”
An amusing episode in which Mr Pickwidk stumbles into the wrong bedroom, is challenged to a duel, and then arrested. He extricates himseslf with the aid of that remarkable man-servant, Sam Weller. From the Charles Dickens story, “The Pickwick Papers”.

results.title: David and Mr Micawber (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David copperfield”. Features Robert Morley as Mr Micawber, one of Dickens’ most memorable characters. Tells of young David’s arrival in London, and his befriending by the Micawbers. Mr Micawber is subsequently imprisoned for debt, is released and departs for Plymouth where with characteristic optimism he is sure “something will turn up”.

results.title: Bardell vs Pickwick
results.creator_credit: Desmond Davis and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Describes the trial for breach of promise and the many amusing moments which arise when Mr. Pickwick’s landlady interprets his discussion regarding the hiring of a man servant as a proposal for marriage. Introduced by Frederic March.

results.title: Miss Havisham
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Miss Havisham, disappointed in love so many years ago, lives among the decayed remains of her wedding banquet. She sponsors a local village boy Pip, but with an ulterior motive - to break his heart through her ward Estella. Cast includes William Demarest, Jane Asher and Joan Hickson.

results.title: Mr Jingle at Dingley Dell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
On their way to Dingley Dell, Mr Pickwick and his friends meet the rascally Alfred Jingle, with his unusual telegraphic style of speech. Tells how Jingle hoodwinks them all, ingratiates himself with Miss Rachel Wardell, elopes with her in the middle of the night, and is finally apprehended by Mr Pickwick. Adapted from Charles Dickens “The Pickwick Papers”. Narrated by Fredric March.

results.title: David and Dora married (from David Copperfield)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tales from Charles Dickens”.
Excerpts from Charles Dickens’ “David Copperfield”. Tells how David and Dora’s idyllic existence begins to wane after their marriage because of Dora’s childlike inexperienced management of the household. Records the disastrous dinner for the uncomplaining Traddles, and the couple’s first quarrel. Shows how David’s acceptance of Dora’s ineptness affords them some final months of happiness before her death.
